ul.li: Use title case capitalization for titles.
Use gerunds for chapter headings. Chapters are the primary headings in a ditamap.

Use imperative construction in task headings that are under chapter headings. Describe what the user wants to do in the user's language.
For example:
Create a new cluster
Configure health checks

Use a noun phrase for concept topic headings.
For example:
CloudWatch overview
Eucalyptus error messages and meanings
Use singular nouns when possible. Users usually act on one thing at a time.
Don't use ampersands (&) in titles or headings, unless you are referring to an API or user interface that contains an ampersand.
Use vs. not v. or versus in headings.
Don't assume the reader has read the heading. Write the first sentence well, assuming no heading understanding.
Make titles and headings brief. Try to avoid making titles or headings longer than one line.
